subject: Poker (Card Game)
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit over the World Series of Poker’s $12 million grand prize has apparently been settled. Jamie Gold, the winner of the event, and Bruce Crispin Leyser, a Los Angeles-based television producer who claimed that Gold had promised to split the jackpot with him, released a joint statement yesterday that said the matter would be resolved “without litigation.” Leyser said Gold agreed to a 50-50 split in exchange for Leyser helping him find celebrities to play while wearing the logo of an Internet gambling site.
